column4: I saw you helping someone earlier with a wireless problem. Care to help me with my issue?
sure, shoot ...
I can't seem to get my broadcom minipc card and driver linked up
what version are you running _
Hardy
what wireless card are you using _
integrat4ed, tells me that is is an USB correct ___
what computer do you have _
a brand new dell vostro 1700
see if it is visible there ...
the driver is bcmwl5
that driver is for dell 1500 card for yours as well ?
the dell site suggests bcmwl6, but every time I have tried to load it, it says invalid driver
all ubuntu documents suggest the bcmwl5
go dells support page and with your service tag look up and download the driver for your service tag and we go from there ...
in dells page downloading the windows xp driver for your wireless card ?
The .exe file with the recommended driver is now downloaded to the desktop.
vista
okey create a directory and place it there and we will not extract it ...
get the windows xp driver for your wireless .....
I hate to be so pitiful, but can you help with that so I don't screw it up
mkdir wireless
i made the directory, how do I move it in there?
please get windows xp version ...
go to the directory wireless with cd wireless
please can you wait for me thay are calling me, i will be back promise ...
the thing is that you are going to download the driver for windows xp into this directory and extract the exefile with unzip xxxx.exe and than use it to install the driver over the old one ...
i will be back in 10 minutes ...
It's downloading, but I am pretty certain it is the one I already have.
I have the file downloaded for the drivers
back ...
thanks, I was getting desperate
you have downloaded the driver from dell that is for windows xp
just the Xp one interests me ...
where is the rxxx.exe file located .
I created the directory, but didn't put anything in it yet
desktop
in the terminal
yes
the last thing I put was mkdir wireless
yes do cd wireless to jumpo in there ...
It is a brand new system with vista.  I used it for a few minuted in vista before the instatll
I am not sure what you wanted me to do.
okey but still i am using only the windos xp but let us hope it contains the file i am looking for ...
you are in the directoy  wireless _
ok.  Now what?
what si the name of the driver you have on the desktop _
The file is Dell_multi-device_A17_R174291.exe
in the desktop
that driver is from dell ___
yes.
okey do in terminal window mv home/<your username>/Desktop/dell .....exe .
you will move the file from desktop to your directory where you are standing that is wireless
the brackets is not a directory it is here you need to put your directory name
it says missing destination file operand after ......
no the ... is that you need ti fill in the while file name ..., one example ..
Here is what I put:  mv home/longfamily/Desktop/Dell_multi-device_A17_R174291.exe
yes and space followed by an dot
mv /home/longfamily/Desktop/Dell_multi-device_A17_R174291.exe .
i suppose you are in the directory wireless
done
I guess.  How would I know?
okey now need to extract the exe file ...
can you see the file there and you are in wireless right ...
I thinks it worked.
here is what my terminal has: longfamily@longfamily-dell:~$
if you see the file than we are doing okey so far ...
nothing about wireless as a file that I am in, but something did happen when i put ls
this is something basic with movement of files that faild ...
When I go to place -> homefolder, it is there
okey do unzip dell file ...
you do this in ubuntu right ?
yes.  the terminal code is unzip dell file?
I am sorry,  I am really just ignorant of much of the terminal terminology.
unzip than follow the name of the windows drivers name ending with .exe
wit h the tab key you can do a lot ...
I know have this file extracted to the desktop: bcmwl5.inf
This is the driver file.  by the way, it is the same file I have already tried to use.
okey the extraction worked ?
I just used the archive manager
okey that is okey now hold on let me see where to enter it again , this is the windows version that worked for me as well, let me see, we are comming to and ned ...
go system->administration->windows wireless driver
I opened it, tried to add new driver and it says invalid driver.
you need to delete the old one and install the new one ...
I did, that's when it said invalid driver.  Before it just said no hardware present for the driver
that never happened to me, sorry i do not know whay it says so _, should have accepted it ...
If Josh04 is around, do you mind if I enlist his help?
Thanks so much for your help.
let me know how it goes ...
there is another thing but i am not sure what is it for ...
What's that
system->administration->hardware testing
Yeah.  I gave that a try, but it didn't give any options specific to wireless
i do not know but you can send some kind of report on hardware but why i do not know but in thzat test my wireless showed up ...
